column4: Should an AMD64 chip running in 32-bit mode OS use linux-k7 ???
just wanted to make sure there was nothing wrong with that
should be there, I'm running it. . .
i thought i saw it before i rebooted from 386 into 686 -- now i dont see it anymore
like bob2 said, just make sure you have "restricted" in your sources.list
here is the package name: linux-image-2.6.12-8-k7
amek sure you have this - deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu breezy-updates main restricted
yes i have that too
I mean this - deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu breezy main restricted ;)
how about multivers and univers?
how about multivers and universe?
do an apt-cache search k7
yes it is there now
yea! ;)
have to include hoary-extras or hoary-backports for that -- or use marilats repo
are there official breezy-extras and breezy-backports yet
the skeleton base structure is there, but I don't think there will actually be any packages until breezy is 'stable'
as long as you are using GDM, then just pick your Session
when you are logging in, just pick the Sessions menu in the bottom left hand corner
ahh yes, thx!
no prob. :)
